page.title: 16COLLESSIE QUESTIONAIRE
page.content: A short questionaire was distributed to each household in Collessie. Of the 21 questionaires distributed only one was not returned. From the survey the population was put at 60 with an average of three per household. The length of time people have lived in Collessie varied from about 1 year to about 70 years. The reasons people gave for living here were the scenic peacefulness and availability of housing in the village. A large proportion of the village's population are retired with the working population travelling as far away as Bathgate and Edinburgh. Only a few people worked locally, reflecting the shortage of rural jobs in farms these days. Due to the lack of regular bus services almost everyone travels to work by car.
